qas.question: In what century did the Ottoman's start to desire foreign manuscripts?
Which sultan ordered a Greek scholar to do translations of work by Ptolemy?
Who did an Ottoman sultan order to translate work by Ptolemy?
How many years did Ali Qushji spend in Istanbul?

context: Over the course of Ottoman history, the Ottomans managed to build a large collection of libraries complete with translations of books from other cultures, as well as original manuscripts. A great part of this desire for local and foreign manuscripts arose in the <a0_0>15th Century<a0_0/>. <a1_0>Sultan Mehmet II<a1_0/> ordered <a2_0>Georgios Amiroutzes<a2_0/>, a Greek scholar from Trabzon, to translate and make available to Ottoman educational institutions the geography book of Ptolemy. Another example is Ali Qushji -an astronomer, mathematician and physicist <a4_0>originally from Samarkand<a4_0/>- who became a professor in two madrasas, and influenced Ottoman circles as a result of his writings and the activities of his students, even though he only spent <a3_0>two or three years<a3_0/> before his death in Istanbul.
